title: How old are the Bake Off finalists?
text:
Will Steph, David or Alice be your 2019 Bake Off winner? (Picture: Channel 4)

Great British Bake Off 2019 has had it all – potential romances, Paul Hollywood being told to ‘shut up’ and, most shocking of all, lidless pies.

The finale airs tonight and soon we’ll have a new reigning Bake Off champ.

Who are the final three contestants hoping to rise to the occasion tonight – and how old are they all?

Here’s what you need to know about the finalists in the youngest series of the show to date…

(Picture: Channel 4)

Steph Blackwell

28-year-old Steph is the bookies’ hot favourite to take the crown tonight.

Previously a star athlete, she channelled that competitive spirit into the competition, earning Star Baker four times.

(Picture: Channel 4)

Alice Fevronia

The 28-year-old geography teacher from London is the bookies’ second favourite to win the show.

As well as the sweet treats in the kitchen, Alice has whipped up a bit of a social media storm during her time on the show.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Fans have been speculating as to whether she and Henry are a couple.

David, the lidless pie culprit (Picture: Channel 4)

David Atherton

The 36-year-old from Yorkshire has taken his love of baking all over the globe.

Before joining the show, he had travelled to Malawi where he invented a cake that could steam cook over a fire.

He’s performed well on the show – despite kicking off a fierce debate as to what can be defined as a pie – but bookies have him as the least favourite to win tonight.

The Great British Bake Off finishes tonight from 8pm on Channel 4.

Got a showbiz story? If you've got a story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk Entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page - we'd love to hear from you.

description: Great British Bake Off 2019 concludes tonight. Who are the final three and how old are they?
